bioghist.p: Bishop Thomas Galberry (1833-1878) was born in County Kildare, Ireland. He entered the Augustinian novitiate at Villanova, Pennsylvania, in 1852. His ordination to the priesthood by Bishop John Neumann of Philadelphia took place in 1856. After his ordination, he served on the mission of Saint Denis’ in Ardmore, Pennsylvania, and Saint Augustine’s in Lansingburg (Troy), New York. Later he served as Prior of Saint Thomas of Villanova Monastery and President of Villanova College from 1872-1876. During this time, the west wing of Alumni Hall was added to the original building. Father Galberrry’s next assignment was as Commissary-General of the Vice Province in America, and, when it became a Province, he was elected its first Provincial. In 1876, he was consecrated the fourth Bishop of Hartford, Connecticut. Bishop Galberry was on his way to Villanova College from Hartford when he died in New York City on 10 October 1878, at the age of 45. He was buried in the Cathedral of Hartford, Connecticut. The Graphic Services building on Villanova University campus is named in his honor.

scopecontent.p: The Thomas Galberry, O.S.A. Papers consists of a clipping of an 1876 newspaper article entitled “Dr. Galberry’s Farewell to Villanova." The article includes a transcription of an address read on the occasion by student John W. O'Sullivan, of Lawrence, Massachusetts.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
